area_name: Water Groove Area (top of Kill Hill)

content.description: At the top of Kill Hill, park in the first area on the right after the cattle guard.  You will see two grouping of rock, one to the right and the other to the left.  Water Groove is located on the southwest corner of the right grouping.  It basically looks like an egg balancing tip down on some rocks. A water groove ascends the south corner in an obvious well.. water groove.  Good luck. I have yet to put this one together.
content.protection: Good flat landing but it tops out at around 25 feet, so a pad and spot are a good idea.

content.description: A small overhanging boulder to the NE of hartmans roof has a single dyno move to the lip from a sit down start.  Fun problem but look out for the rock behind it.
content.protection: Crash pad might help but not necessary.

content.description: After reaching the top of Kill Hill make the first right after the cattle guard and park at the area straight ahead.  After parking look to the south and you will see the boulders that you past on the way in.  The first obvious boulder right ahead contains two known routes starting as a sit start with a sloping rail rising right to left.  "Grin and Bear It" starts at the rail in the dirt and goes left. Pull the rail until it ends then go big around the corner to the jug.  Make a finese move to the crimp in the black face, left to vertical jug.  Pull the move to the sloping lip and the hidden crimp top out.  This is the first problem I can put my name on, I gave the best estimate of a rating so enjoy and let me know what you think.
content.protection: Kind of a messy landing with a slab sloping into the climb located right under the fall.  A crash pad is not recommended due to the fact that they can reduce friction and if you fall you need to hit the slope and stick not slide.

content.description: Start on undercling and move up the face with a mixture or tiny crimps and compressiony moves.
content.location: This is the prominent face of this free standing boulder. From Jaw Arete, head right a bit. You can't miss it.

pathTokens: Water Groove Area (top of Kill Hill)
